events.originalText: Hillary Clinton was elected a US senator, the first time a first lady had been elected to public office.
events.subtitle: Hillary Clinton
events.headline: Hillary Clinton Elected as US Senator

events.originalText: Magic Johnson announced his retirement from professional basketball due to HIV infection.
events.subtitle: Magic Johnson
events.headline: Magic Johnson Retires from Basketball Due to HIV Infection

events.originalText: Singapore's first Mass Rapid Transit line opened (train pictured), with train services running between Yio Chu Kang and Toa Payoh.
events.subtitle: Mass Rapid Transit (Singapore)
events.headline: Singapore's First Mass Rapid Transit Line Opens

events.originalText: Tunisian prime minister Zine El Abidine Ben Ali deposed and replaced President Habib Bourguiba by declaring him medically unfit for the duties of the office.
events.subtitle: Zine El Abidine Ben Ali
events.headline: Tunisian Prime Minister Zine El Abidine Ben Ali Deposes President Habib Bourguiba

events.originalText: Oil was discovered in the Caspian Sea off the coast of Azerbaijan, leading to the construction of Neft Daşları, the world's first offshore oil platform.
events.subtitle: Caspian Sea
events.headline: Oil Discovered in Caspian Sea, Leading to Construction of Neft Daşları

events.originalText: World War I: British forces captured Gaza following the retreat of the Ottoman garrison.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: British Forces Capture Gaza in World War I

events.originalText: In the congressional elections, Jeannette Rankin became the first woman elected to the United States House of Representatives.
events.subtitle: 1916 United States House of Representatives elections
events.headline: Jeannette Rankin Becomes First Woman Elected to US House of Representatives

events.originalText: American Civil War: Future U.S. President Ulysses S. Grant engaged in his first combat leadership role in the Battle of Belmont in Mississippi County, Missouri.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Ulysses S. Grant Engages in First Combat Leadership Role in American Civil War

events.originalText: American abolitionist Elijah Parish Lovejoy was murdered by a pro-slavery mob in Alton, Illinois, during an attack to destroy his printing press and abolitionist materials.
events.subtitle: Abolitionism in the United States
events.headline: American Abolitionist Elijah Parish Lovejoy Murdered by Pro-Slavery Mob

events.originalText: Tecumseh's War: American forces led by William Henry Harrison defeated the forces of Shawnee leader Tecumseh's growing confederation at the Battle of Tippecanoe near present-day Battle Ground, Indiana.
events.subtitle: Tecumseh's War
events.headline: American Forces Defeat Tecumseh's Confederation at Battle of Tippecanoe

events.originalText: Lord Dunmore, the royal governor of the Colony of Virginia, signed a proclamation promising freedom for the slaves of Patriots if they joined the British Armed Forces.
events.subtitle: John Murray, 4th Earl of Dunmore
events.headline: Lord Dunmore Signs Proclamation Promising Freedom to Slaves Joining British Armed Forces

events.originalText: O Ewigkeit, du Donnerwort, BWV 60, a dialogue cantata by Johann Sebastian Bach (pictured) for Leipzig, was first performed.
events.subtitle: O Ewigkeit, du Donnerwort, BWV 60
events.headline: Johann Sebastian Bach's Cantata BWV 60 First Performed in Leipzig

events.originalText: The Third Council of Constantinople convened to settle the Christological controversies of monoenergism and monothelitism.
events.subtitle: Third Council of Constantinople
events.headline: Third Council of Constantinople Convenes to Settle Christological Controversies
